intro: Papistylus, commonly known as the sacred lotus of ancient Egypt, is a flowering plant with striking botanical features. It belongs to the Nymphaeaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that open at dawn. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves that float on the surface of still water. Its roots are aquatic and help in stabilizing the water ecosystem. The flowers are typically pink or white, with a distinctive central stigma surrounded by numerous stamens.
